segment.source: How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: Use the following procedures to modify an existing virtual application package.
segment.target: Use the following procedures to modify an existing virtual application package.

segment.source: You can use these procedures to:
segment.target: You can use these procedures to:

segment.source: Update an application that is part of an existing virtual application package.
segment.target: Update an application that is part of an existing virtual application package.

segment.source: To perform this task, use the procedure "To update an application in an existing application package" in this document.
segment.target: To perform this task, use the procedure "To update an application in an existing application package" in this document.

segment.source: Modify the properties associated with an existing virtual application package.
segment.target: Modify the properties associated with an existing virtual application package.

segment.source: To perform this task, use the procedure "To modify the properties associated with an existing virtual application package" in this document.
segment.target: To perform this task, use the procedure "To modify the properties associated with an existing virtual application package" in this document.

segment.source: Add a new application to an existing virtual application package.
segment.target: Add a new application to an existing virtual application package.

segment.source: To perform this task, use the procedure "To add a new application to an existing virtual application package" in this document.
segment.target: To perform this task, use the procedure "To add a new application to an existing virtual application package" in this document.

segment.source: You must have the App-V Sequencer installed to modify a virtual application package.
segment.target: You must have the App-V Sequencer installed to modify a virtual application package.

segment.source: For more information about installing the App-V Sequencer, see How to Install the Sequencer (App-V 4.6 SP1).
segment.target: For more information about installing the App-V Sequencer, see How to Install the Sequencer (App-V 4.6 SP1).

segment.source: To update an application in an existing virtual application package
segment.target: To update an application in an existing virtual application package

segment.source: To start the App-V Sequencer, on the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: To start the App-V Sequencer, on the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: In the App-V Sequencer, click Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package, and then click Next.
segment.target: In the App-V Sequencer, click Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Select Task page, click Update Application in Existing Package, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Select Task page, click Update Application in Existing Package, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Select Package page, click Browse to locate the virtual application package that contains the application that you want to update, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Select Package page, click Browse to locate the virtual application package that contains the application that you want to update, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Prepare Computer page, review the issues that could cause the application update to fail, or for the application update to contain unnecessary data.
segment.target: On the Prepare Computer page, review the issues that could cause the application update to fail, or for the application update to contain unnecessary data.

segment.source: We strongly recommend that you resolve all potential issues before you continue.
segment.target: We strongly recommend that you resolve all potential issues before you continue.

segment.source: After you have fixed the conflicts, to update the information that is displayed, click Refresh.
segment.target: After you have fixed the conflicts, to update the information that is displayed, click Refresh.

segment.source: After you have resolved all potential issues, click Next.
segment.target: After you have resolved all potential issues, click Next.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you are required to disable virus scanning software, scan the computer running the sequencer to ensure that no unwanted or malicious files are added to the package.
segment.target: If you are required to disable virus scanning software, scan the computer running the sequencer to ensure that no unwanted or malicious files are added to the package.

segment.source: On the Select Installer page, click Browse and specify the update installation file for the application.
segment.target: On the Select Installer page, click Browse and specify the update installation file for the application.

segment.source: If the update does not have an associated installer file and you plan to run all installation steps manually, select the Select this option to perform a custom installation check box, and then click Next.
segment.target: If the update does not have an associated installer file and you plan to run all installation steps manually, select the Select this option to perform a custom installation check box, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Installation page, when the sequencer and application installer are ready, install the application update so the sequencer can monitor the installation process.
segment.target: On the Installation page, when the sequencer and application installer are ready, install the application update so the sequencer can monitor the installation process.

segment.source: If additional installation files must be run as part of the installation, click Run and locate and run the additional installation files.
segment.target: If additional installation files must be run as part of the installation, click Run and locate and run the additional installation files.

segment.source: When you are finished with the installation, select I am finished installing.
segment.target: When you are finished with the installation, select I am finished installing.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The sequencer monitors all changes and installations to the computer running the sequencer, including the changes and installations that are performed outside of the sequencing wizard.
segment.target: The sequencer monitors all changes and installations to the computer running the sequencer, including the changes and installations that are performed outside of the sequencing wizard.

segment.source: On the Installation Report page, you can review information about the virtual application you just updated.
segment.target: On the Installation Report page, you can review information about the virtual application you just updated.

segment.source: For a more detailed explanation about the information displayed in Additional Information, double-click the event.
segment.target: For a more detailed explanation about the information displayed in Additional Information, double-click the event.

segment.source: After you have reviewed the information, click Next.
segment.target: After you have reviewed the information, click Next.

segment.source: On the Streaming page, run each program so that it can be optimized and run more efficiently on target computers.
segment.target: On the Streaming page, run each program so that it can be optimized and run more efficiently on target computers.

segment.source: It can take several minutes for all the applications to run.
segment.target: It can take several minutes for all the applications to run.

segment.source: After all applications have run, close each of the applications, and then click Next.
segment.target: After all applications have run, close each of the applications, and then click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you want to stop an application from loading during this step, in the Application Launch dialog box, click Stop, and then click one of the following options, Stop all applications or Stop this application only, depending on what you want.
segment.target: If you want to stop an application from loading during this step, in the Application Launch dialog box, click Stop, and then click one of the following options, Stop all applications or Stop this application only, depending on what you want.

segment.source: On the Create Package page, to modify the package without saving it, select the Continue to modify package without saving using the package editor check box.
segment.target: On the Create Package page, to modify the package without saving it, select the Continue to modify package without saving using the package editor check box.

segment.source: When you select this option, the package in the Sequencer console opens so that you can modify the package before it is saved.
segment.target: When you select this option, the package in the Sequencer console opens so that you can modify the package before it is saved.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: To save the package immediately, select the default Save the package now.
segment.target: To save the package immediately, select the default Save the package now.

segment.source: Add optional Comments that will be associated with the package.
segment.target: Add optional Comments that will be associated with the package.

segment.source: Comments are useful for identifying version and other information about the package.
segment.target: Comments are useful for identifying version and other information about the package.

segment.source: The default Save Location is also displayed.
segment.target: The default Save Location is also displayed.

segment.source: To change the default location, click Browse and specify the new location.
segment.target: To change the default location, click Browse and specify the new location.

segment.source: The uncompressed package size is displayed.
segment.target: The uncompressed package size is displayed.

segment.source: If the package size exceeds 4 GB (uncompressed) and you plan to stream the package to target computers, you must select Compress Package, and then click Create.
segment.target: If the package size exceeds 4 GB (uncompressed) and you plan to stream the package to target computers, you must select Compress Package, and then click Create.

segment.source: On the Completion page, click Close to close the wizard.
segment.target: On the Completion page, click Close to close the wizard.

segment.source: The package is now available in the sequencer.
segment.target: The package is now available in the sequencer.

segment.source: To modify the properties associated with an existing virtual application package
segment.target: To modify the properties associated with an existing virtual application package

segment.source: To start the App-V Sequencer, on the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: To start the App-V Sequencer, on the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: In the App-V Sequencer, click Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package, and then click Next.
segment.target: In the App-V Sequencer, click Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Select Task page, click Edit Package, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Select Task page, click Edit Package, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Select Package page, click Browse to locate the virtual application package that contains the application properties that you want to modify, and then click Edit.
segment.target: On the Select Package page, click Browse to locate the virtual application package that contains the application properties that you want to modify, and then click Edit.

segment.source: In the Sequencer console, you can perform any of the following tasks:
segment.target: In the Sequencer console, you can perform any of the following tasks:

segment.source: View package properties.
segment.target: View package properties.

segment.source: View package change history.
segment.target: View package change history.

segment.source: View associated package files.
segment.target: View associated package files.

segment.source: Edit registry settings.
segment.target: Edit registry settings.

segment.source: Review additional package settings (except operating system file properties).
segment.target: Review additional package settings (except operating system file properties).

segment.source: Create an associated Windows Installer (MSI).
segment.target: Create an associated Windows Installer (MSI).

segment.source: Modify OSD file.
segment.target: Modify OSD file.

segment.source: Compress and uncompress package.
segment.target: Compress and uncompress package.

segment.source: Add file type associations.
segment.target: Add file type associations.

segment.source: Set virtualized registry key state (override or merge).
segment.target: Set virtualized registry key state (override or merge).

segment.source: Set virtualized folder state.
segment.target: Set virtualized folder state.

segment.source: Edit virtual file system mappings.
segment.target: Edit virtual file system mappings.

segment.source: When you have finished modifying the package properties, click FileSave to save the package,.
segment.target: When you have finished modifying the package properties, click FileSave to save the package,.

segment.source: To add a new application to an existing virtual application package
segment.target: To add a new application to an existing virtual application package

segment.source: To start the App-V Sequencer, on the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: To start the App-V Sequencer, on the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: In the App-V Sequencer, click Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package, and then click Next.
segment.target: In the App-V Sequencer, click Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Select Task page, click Add New Application, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Select Task page, click Add New Application, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Select Package page, click Browse to locate the virtual application package that you want to add the application to, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Select Package page, click Browse to locate the virtual application package that you want to add the application to, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Prepare Computer page, review the issues that could cause the package creation to fail, or for the update to contain unnecessary data.
segment.target: On the Prepare Computer page, review the issues that could cause the package creation to fail, or for the update to contain unnecessary data.

segment.source: We strongly recommend that you resolve all potential issues before you continue.
segment.target: We strongly recommend that you resolve all potential issues before you continue.

segment.source: After you have fixed the conflicts, to update the information that is displayed, click Refresh.
segment.target: After you have fixed the conflicts, to update the information that is displayed, click Refresh.

segment.source: After you have resolved all potential issues, click Next.
segment.target: After you have resolved all potential issues, click Next.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you are required to disable virus scanning software, scan the computer running the sequencer to ensure that no unwanted or malicious files can be added to the package.
segment.target: If you are required to disable virus scanning software, scan the computer running the sequencer to ensure that no unwanted or malicious files can be added to the package.

segment.source: On the Select Installer page, click Browse and specify the installation file for the application.
segment.target: On the Select Installer page, click Browse and specify the installation file for the application.

segment.source: If the application does not have an associated installer file and you plan to run all installation steps manually, select the Select this option to perform a custom installation check box, and then click Next.
segment.target: If the application does not have an associated installer file and you plan to run all installation steps manually, select the Select this option to perform a custom installation check box, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Installation page, when the sequencer and application installer are ready, install the application so the sequencer can monitor the installation process.
segment.target: On the Installation page, when the sequencer and application installer are ready, install the application so the sequencer can monitor the installation process.

segment.source: If additional installation files must be run as part of the installation, click Run, and locate and run the additional installation files.
segment.target: If additional installation files must be run as part of the installation, click Run, and locate and run the additional installation files.

segment.source: When you are finished with the installation, select I am finished installing.
segment.target: When you are finished with the installation, select I am finished installing.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: In the Browse for Folder dialog box, specify the primary directory where the application will be installed.
segment.target: In the Browse for Folder dialog box, specify the primary directory where the application will be installed.

segment.source: This should be a new location so that you do not overwrite the existing version of the virtual application package.
segment.target: This should be a new location so that you do not overwrite the existing version of the virtual application package.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: All changes and installations to the computer running the sequencer are monitored by the sequencer, including the changes and installations that are performed outside of the sequencing wizard.
segment.target: All changes and installations to the computer running the sequencer are monitored by the sequencer, including the changes and installations that are performed outside of the sequencing wizard.

segment.source: On the Configure Software page, optionally run the programs contained in the package.
segment.target: On the Configure Software page, optionally run the programs contained in the package.

segment.source: This step helps complete any associated license or configuration tasks that are required to run the application before you deploy and run the package on target computers.
segment.target: This step helps complete any associated license or configuration tasks that are required to run the application before you deploy and run the package on target computers.

segment.source: To run all the programs at the same time, select at least one program, and then click Run All.
segment.target: To run all the programs at the same time, select at least one program, and then click Run All.

segment.source: To run specific programs, select the program or programs you want to run, and then click Run Selected.
segment.target: To run specific programs, select the program or programs you want to run, and then click Run Selected.

segment.source: Complete the required configuration tasks and then close the applications.
segment.target: Complete the required configuration tasks and then close the applications.

segment.source: It can take several minutes for all programs to run.
segment.target: It can take several minutes for all programs to run.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Installation Report page, you can review information about the virtual application you just updated.
segment.target: On the Installation Report page, you can review information about the virtual application you just updated.

segment.source: For a more detailed explanation about the information displayed in Additional Information, double-click the event.
segment.target: For a more detailed explanation about the information displayed in Additional Information, double-click the event.

segment.source: After you have reviewed the information, click Next.
segment.target: After you have reviewed the information, click Next.

segment.source: On the Customize page, if you are finished installing and configuring the virtual application, select Stop now and skip to step 14 of this procedure.
segment.target: On the Customize page, if you are finished installing and configuring the virtual application, select Stop now and skip to step 14 of this procedure.

segment.source: If you want to customize any of the items in the following list, click Customize.
segment.target: If you want to customize any of the items in the following list, click Customize.

segment.source: Edit the file type associations associated with an application.
segment.target: Edit the file type associations associated with an application.

segment.source: Prepare the virtual package for streaming.
segment.target: Prepare the virtual package for streaming.

segment.source: Streaming improves the experience when the virtual application package is run on target computers.
segment.target: Streaming improves the experience when the virtual application package is run on target computers.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Edit Shortcuts page, you can optionally configure the file type associations (FTA) that will be associated with the various applications in the package.
segment.target: On the Edit Shortcuts page, you can optionally configure the file type associations (FTA) that will be associated with the various applications in the package.

segment.source: To create a new FTA, select and expand the application that you want to customize in the left pane, and then click Add.
segment.target: To create a new FTA, select and expand the application that you want to customize in the left pane, and then click Add.

segment.source: In the Add File Type Association dialog box, provide the necessary information for the new FTA.
segment.target: In the Add File Type Association dialog box, provide the necessary information for the new FTA.

segment.source: To review the shortcut information associated with an application, under the application, select the Shortcuts check box, and in the Location pane, you can review the icon file information.
segment.target: To review the shortcut information associated with an application, under the application, select the Shortcuts check box, and in the Location pane, you can review the icon file information.

segment.source: To edit an existing FTA, click Edit.
segment.target: To edit an existing FTA, click Edit.

segment.source: To remove an FTA, select the FTA, and then click Remove.
segment.target: To remove an FTA, select the FTA, and then click Remove.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Streaming page, run each program so that it can be optimized and run more efficiently on target computers.
segment.target: On the Streaming page, run each program so that it can be optimized and run more efficiently on target computers.

segment.source: It can take several minutes for all the applications to run.
segment.target: It can take several minutes for all the applications to run.

segment.source: After all applications have run, close each of the applications, and then click Next.
segment.target: After all applications have run, close each of the applications, and then click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you want to stop an application from loading during this step, in the Application Launch dialog box, click Stop and select either the Stop all applications or the Stop this application only check box, depending on what you want.
segment.target: If you want to stop an application from loading during this step, in the Application Launch dialog box, click Stop and select either the Stop all applications or the Stop this application only check box, depending on what you want.

segment.source: On the Create Package page, select the Continue to modify package without saving using the package editor check box, to modify the package without saving it.
segment.target: On the Create Package page, select the Continue to modify package without saving using the package editor check box, to modify the package without saving it.

segment.source: When you select this option, the package in the sequencer console opens so that you can modify the package before it is saved.
segment.target: When you select this option, the package in the sequencer console opens so that you can modify the package before it is saved.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Select the default Save the package now, to save the package immediately.
segment.target: Select the default Save the package now, to save the package immediately.

segment.source: Add optional Comments that will be associated with the package.
segment.target: Add optional Comments that will be associated with the package.

segment.source: Comments are useful for identifying version and other information about the package.
segment.target: Comments are useful for identifying version and other information about the package.

segment.source: The default Save Location is also displayed.
segment.target: The default Save Location is also displayed.

segment.source: To change the default location, click Browse and specify the new location.
segment.target: To change the default location, click Browse and specify the new location.

segment.source: The uncompressed package size is displayed.
segment.target: The uncompressed package size is displayed.

segment.source: If the package size exceeds 4 GB (uncompressed) and you plan to stream the package to target computers, you must select Compress Package.
segment.target: If the package size exceeds 4 GB (uncompressed) and you plan to stream the package to target computers, you must select Compress Package.

segment.source: Click Create.
segment.target: Click Create.

segment.source: On the Completion page, click Close.
segment.target: On the Completion page, click Close.

segment.source: The package is now available in the sequencer.
segment.target: The package is now available in the sequencer.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Tasks for the Application Virtualization Sequencer (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: Tasks for the Application Virtualization Sequencer (App-V 4.6 SP1)
